questions.question_text_1: Distance covered by a runner in the first five days of training are 3 km, 5 km, 3 km, 6 km, and 7 km. If the runner covers a distance of 4 km on the sixth day, then how does it affect his overall performance?
question_texts: Distance covered by a runner in the first five days of training are 3 km, 5 km, 3 km, 6 km, and 7 km. If the runner covers a distance of 4 km on the sixth day, then how does it affect his overall performance?

options.option_text: The mean of the distances will increase.
The mode of the distances will decrease.
The median of the distances will decrease.
Range of the distances will decrease.

options.option_text: Point-bi serial method is appropriate to find the association between twocategorical variables.
Scatter plot is more appropriate to represent the relationship between twonumerical variables.
There is no available method for determining the association between acategorical and a numerical variable.
Covariance can be computed only for two numerical variables.
